brief.content-text:
Single Diagram
Diagram 1, Animation
The diagram depicts an image of a coaxial cable that has been broken down into pieces to get a better understanding of its physical composition, as follows:
TERMINATION
Coaxial is usually terminated with a BNC or F-series connector.
BNC is a crimped-down connector and is typically considered a stronger connection.
F-series connectors is a screw-down connector.

BRAID
A metallic braid of copper or aluminum foil helps to shield against EMI.

INSULATOR
An insulator, usually made of polyethylene, that both protects against EMI and provides strength to the cable by allowing it to be more pliable.

CONDUCTOR
A single center conductor, most often made of copper, though aluminum can be used as well.
